00005 #ifndef LUABIND_INHERITANCE_090217_HPP
00006 # define LUABIND_INHERITANCE_090217_HPP

00008 # include <cassert>
00009 # include <limits>

00014 # include <boost/scoped_ptr.hpp>

00016 namespace luabind { namespace detail {
00017 
00018 typedef void*(*cast_function)(void*);
00019 typedef std::size_t class_id;
00020 
00021 class_id const unknown_class = (std::numeric_limits<class_id>::max)();
00022 
00023 class class_rep;
00024 
00025 class LUABIND_API cast_graph
00026 {
00027 public:
00028     cast_graph();
00029     ~cast_graph();
00030 
00031     // `src` and `p` here describe the *most derived* object. This means that
00032     // for a polymorphic type, the pointer must be cast with
00033     // dynamic_cast<void*> before being passed in here, and `src` has to
00034     // match typeid(*p).
00035     std::pair<void*, int> cast(
00036         void* p, class_id src, class_id target
00037       , class_id dynamic_id, void const* dynamic_ptr) const;
00038     void insert(class_id src, class_id target, cast_function cast);
00039 
00040 private:
00041     class impl;
00042     boost::scoped_ptr<impl> m_impl;
00043 };
00044 
00045 // Maps a type_id to a class_id. Note that this actually partitions the
00046 // id-space into two, using one half for "local" ids; ids that are used only as
00047 // keys into the conversion cache. This is needed because we need a unique key
00048 // even for types that hasn't been registered explicitly.
00049 class LUABIND_API class_id_map
00050 {
00051 public:
00052     class_id_map();
00053 
00054     class_id get(type_id const& type) const;
00055     class_id get_local(type_id const& type);
00056     void put(class_id id, type_id const& type);
00057 
00058 private:
00059     typedef std::map<type_id, class_id> map_type;
00060     map_type m_classes;
00061     class_id m_local_id;
00062 
00063     static class_id const local_id_base;
00064 };
00065 
00066 inline class_id_map::class_id_map()
00067   : m_local_id(local_id_base)
00068 {}
00069 
00070 inline class_id class_id_map::get(type_id const& type) const
00071 {
00072     map_type::const_iterator i = m_classes.find(type);
00073     if (i == m_classes.end() || i->second >= local_id_base)
00074         return unknown_class;
00075     return i->second;
00076 }
00077 
00078 inline class_id class_id_map::get_local(type_id const& type)
00079 {
00080     std::pair<map_type::iterator, bool> result = m_classes.insert(
00081         std::make_pair(type, 0));
00082 
00083     if (result.second)
00084         result.first->second = m_local_id++;
00085 
00086     assert(m_local_id >= local_id_base);
00087 
00088     return result.first->second;
00089 }
00090 
00091 inline void class_id_map::put(class_id id, type_id const& type)
00092 {
00093     assert(id < local_id_base);
00094 
00095     std::pair<map_type::iterator, bool> result = m_classes.insert(
00096         std::make_pair(type, 0));
00097 
00098     assert(
00099         result.second
00100         || result.first->second == id
00101         || result.first->second >= local_id_base
00102     );
00103 
00104     result.first->second = id;
00105 }
00106 
00107 class class_map
00108 {
00109 public:
00110     class_rep* get(class_id id) const;
00111     void put(class_id id, class_rep* cls);
00112 
00113 private:
00114     std::vector<class_rep*> m_classes;
00115 };
00116 
00117 inline class_rep* class_map::get(class_id id) const
00118 {
00119     if (id >= m_classes.size())
00120         return 0;
00121     return m_classes[id];
00122 }
00123 
00124 inline void class_map::put(class_id id, class_rep* cls)
00125 {
00126     if (id >= m_classes.size())
00127         m_classes.resize(id + 1);
00128     m_classes[id] = cls;
00129 }
00130 
00131 template <class S, class T>
00132 struct static_cast_
00133 {
00134     static void* execute(void* p)
00135     {
00136         return static_cast<T*>(static_cast<S*>(p));
00137     }
00138 };
00139 
00140 template <class S, class T>
00141 struct dynamic_cast_
00142 {
00143     static void* execute(void* p)
00144     {
00145         return dynamic_cast<T*>(static_cast<S*>(p));
00146     }
00147 };
00148 
00149 // Thread safe class_id allocation.
00150 LUABIND_API class_id allocate_class_id(type_id const& cls);
00151 
00152 template <class T>
00153 struct registered_class
00154 {
00155     static class_id const id;
00156 };
00157 
00158 template <class T>
00159 class_id const registered_class<T>::id = allocate_class_id(typeid(T));
00160 
00161 template <class T>
00162 struct registered_class<T const>
00163   : registered_class<T>
00164 {};
00165
